content.rendered:
A value education session was conducted for school children under Smile Foundation’s Child for Child (CFC) programme in Nilgiri Hills Public School, Noida, Uttar Pradesh. Over 700 children attended the early morning session, which included the importance of hygiene, including hygiene education, oral, daily, home and environment hygiene, and mental sanity.

Under its CFC programme, Smile Foundation visits various privileged schools across India and conducts engaging sessions for young minds. Children are sensitised to various causes and value systems and are ushered to realise their importance in growing up as responsible citizens of the country.

During the last one year, Smile Foundation reached out to nearly 1.8 Million privileged children in over 4,400 schools spread across 417 districts of India, through Child For Child (CFC) programme. In addition, their parents and teachers were also involved in the process.
